Reviews.Title: “Refreshing different, and a fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: smilendesusi
Reviews.Content: Compared to other very good hotels in Berlin ( personally experienced 18 tophotels in Berlin) and the rest of the world, this hotel has become my favorite,..... and it is the only one that keeps me coming back!!!! I am always welcomed in a way by the staff, so I feel this is my second home. And the staff is really very good to spot what I like and what makes my stay special. The staff is absolute exceptional in international standards. The hotel is refreshing different in design. It takes a good deal of courage to build a hotel like this, and it works! It is a fantastic idea to incorporate music as a part of the life and identity. Music is and has always been a passion of mine, so I love it! The hotel is placed by the river in a very Berlin hot spot. The view is fantastic and I recommend to take a room to the riverside. It is easy to get to the hotel both when I fly and when I drive( lots of parking space). Everything can be reached by U or S Bahn. Or by bicycle. I prefer this location, it has a more authentic Berlin vibe, than most touristic parts of Berlin. The food and service in the restaurant Fabric has always been very good, fun and special. Try it!!! And the bar and great terrace is a fantastic place to hang out all day. I will recommend everybody interested in music or just a fun evening to come and experience "open mic" concerts the first Saturday every month. I personally try to plan my business so I can join the party. I will be back again and again, and I can only say one thing: try it!!

Reviews.Title: “NHOW Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Thomas K
Reviews.Content: This is the most cool and funky hotel we've ever stayed at! Everybody is friendly and helpful to an extreme extent. Before we discovered nhow we have stayed in maybe 20 different hotels in Berlin, but n(h)ow coming back here, feels like coming home. If you have the possibility and like live music, stay there on the first Saturday in the month for the 'Open Mic Night' in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nhow berlin”
Reviews.Author: ROY S
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Nhow berlin, we stayed the weekend there during our lat visit on March. We wanted especially to thank the hotel staff that was very pleasant and attentive. they were available anytime to assist us with all our needs. Also we would like to point out the amazing design of the whole hotel by Karim Rashid. every detail was counted and thought through. the food is great and the view from the rooms is breathtaking. we would defiantly come again. don't miss out! Roy&Shlomit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ritsert M
Reviews.Content: We've chosen this spot for the central location: a few minutes walk to the lifeline of Berlin's public transport, Warschauer strasse, which brings you in a few minutes to the centre and because of it's most iconic view at and from the Oberbaum bridge over the city. In the hood surrounding the hotel you can really feel Berlin without the tourist hassle! The serice was better than we'd expected, when we looked for concert-tickets of a show that evening which was sold out, the congierge tried his best and even called his own friends to find tickets! The whole staff was extremely nice and helpfull and made us feel like we were at home.

Reviews.Title: “My dream suite!!! :)))”
Reviews.Author: MLML64291
Reviews.Content: Still in awe after staying there 3 weeks ago for the ITB Fair. A very musician-friendly hotel. I stayed at the Junior suite for 2 days & was very surprised at how spacey the room is. It even has a white electric piano & you can order guitar-room-service for free! The design is just awesome like you're in some kind of sci-fi movie. And the colors are exactly my taste! It's like this hotel was built & designed for me. :D Really WOWWWW!!!! I had some lyrics printed out for free, too! Plus, free WiFi & friendly staff just make the stay really worthwhile. I've found my new favorite hotel in Berlin now. And it's called, NHOW! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Lovers escape :-D”
Reviews.Author: Stefasemota
Reviews.Content: #nhow is differing from all other hotels; not ordinary. The hotel strives continually to be different in every each way. I fancy this hotel not because it's different but mainly because they think differently, unconventionally or rather from a new perspective. My wife and I had an excellent experience here, we stayed in a "Junior Suite" room colors was in pink / white, the suite was spotlessly clean and I could even practice on the piano ;-). Beds are perfect and we even woke up to a delicious and endless breakfast the next morning. The desk & concierge service are Excellent. The back bar / lounge area are responsive design and neutral color. The staff was super fly and 100% responsive. The nhow is kind of like music.. either you like it or you don't like it ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Bisarrt litet musikhotell”
Reviews.Author: Offtherecord
Reviews.Content: Stayed at nhow for a three day conference witch gave me the chance to enjoy the tiny pink room with a very small bed and a see though bathroom wall... witch might not be the best option when sharing with co-worker. Anyway - the hotel is pretty cool, with a huge lobby, free wifi, live DJ and a decent bar. The service was helpful and the colorful interior is, if nothing else, different. The food wasn't anything special, but that seems to be a city wide problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pink and poorly designed”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: The rooms ae small and the collie pink dominates all areas. Despite advertising free wifi it's only free in the lobbly and everywhere else will set you back €10.70 per day (rip-off). The bar doesn't sell German draught beer and the rooms are poorly designed with inadequate luggage shelf and power outlets. There's a lot better in Berlun at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about nhow”
Reviews.Author: Mastemah
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the nhow Hotel Berlin together with my wife for two nights in February 2012Ov. We were having a weekend visit of Berlin. Location: Overall not bad. It will take you approximately 30 minutes to arrive from the aiport Tegel with a cab, the nearest subway (U2) and S-Bahn station is Warschauer Straße, which will take you to Alexander Platz and other areas. The station is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is directly at the Spree, one side overlooking the Spree, the other side facing a lifely street. The location itself was great for us, as we were looking to visit a lot of places in Kreutzberg and Friedrichshain, however, getting to the Kurfürstendamm can take a while. Rooms: Standard rooms will overlook the busy street and the surcharge for rooms facing the Spree is quite high with 25 EUR / night (this was offered to us upon arrival). The pink interior itself is definitely something special, however, as a lot of the materials used are plastics which kind of gives you a "cheap" impression. Especially the floor in our room was made of pvc/rubber, which I personally did not like. Our bathroom was not too big, but ok, however, the wall separating the bedroom from the bath was partly transparent (you could see the silhouette of the person in the bath) which could be awkward if it's not a couple travelling. The beds are comfy and we always got a good rest. From our room overviewing the Spree, we didn't not hear the street. We thought the service in the hotel was not too attentive. My wife was asking for nice places to go to in Friedrichshein or Kreutzberg and we were told that there would not be so much and we should rather look to Friedrichsstraße and Ku'damm. Actually, the most interesting parts we saw in Berlin were in those quarters, so if we would have followed the instructions, we might have really missed an interesting part of the city (although of course we also went to Friedrichsstraße and the other shopping mile). Which I didn't like at all was the pricing in the hotel. I paid for an espresso (just the espresso, no little treat or glas of water, or anything) 3 EUR. The breakfast was 22 EUR per person and as already mentioned, for views over the Spree a surcharge of 25 EUR / night is applicable. Internet is not free in the rooms, but they refer to a free internet in the lobby. However, this one being so weak, that you can hardly use it. Also, you need to log on every 30 minutes with a voucher again, so that retrieving big e-mails (which will take a while because of the weak connection) can be a real pain. Basically, you cannot really use it for working but you would have to get internet in the rooms (judging from the rest of the pricing in the hotel, I think it must be expensive, too). The overall theme of the hotel is music, so there's electrical guitars and drums and pianos standing in the lobby, so the design is somewhat hip, but I also thought that other hotels following such design strategies manage to bring that feeling more naturally across (e.g. the 25hours hotels in Frankfurt and Vienna or the Pentahotel in Vienna). Overall I think that the hotel is ok. Highlights are definitely the design (which however will challange your taste) and I also thought the location was great, if you're looking into visiting also other neighbourhoods than Charlottenburg and Mitte. A downturn was the pricing strategy in the hotel, which included incredibly high rates for almost everything. Personally, I would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: karmefunk
Reviews.Content: loved the modern design, the colors, music branded all around.. fantastic! impressed of the shower size in the room and the delicious breakfast! definitely my choice if I go back to berlin again

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel for fun stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: polandpi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very well designed! we have had 3 standard rooms and one at top floor with fantastic view on river and all city! Great breakfast, fantastic wellness (3 different saunas) and nice bar. Only problem was service which wasn't as attentive and well trained as you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Vibrant & inspiring”
Reviews.Author: Peachy79
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great value for money, very creative and inspiring colour palette and design. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “East was Best”
Reviews.Author: DJKTraveler
Reviews.Content: My companion and I had an excellent experience here. Excellent desk and concierge service. A delicious and nearly endless breakfast. Easy and laid back bar / lounge area. The staff was super friendly and 100% responsive to any questions or requests. Our room was spotlessly clean. From our experience, it is a very well managed hotel with a very western service mentality. Yeah, there's a lot of pink and some whacky furniture in the lobby, but find another hotel that offers guitars from room service, or has several authentic elements of the Berlin Wall that have been saved as cultural icons on the premises. Tip: The location is an easy 5 or 6 minute walk to Berlin's local S-Bahn surface train station, so you don't have to rely on taxis all of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Different in every Way”
Reviews.Author: AshleyBlair74
Reviews.Content: This is not your average hotel. If you are a conservative type who does not like to be challenged to think outside the square or a guy who feels his gender identification might be challenged by sleeping in pink sheers in a pink themed bed room this is not the hotel for you. If you are comfortable with who you are; enjoy being challenged by something different and are engaged by what is edgy and funky, then try this hotel in what is now Europe's edgiest, funkiest city. Apart from the pastel (mainly pink) themed decor and eccentric interior design, the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. Housekeeping do not have the same annoying habit, that I am finding in most hotels these days) of barging in and knocking later or not at all. The rooms have safes large enough for laptops an plenty of other valuables. There are bedside powerpoints as well as all connections for all types of media connectivity. It was an interesting clientele mix - standard business types, young creative types...even a guy wearing pantyhose with shorts and high heels sitting by the bar just fitting in normally. Same guy was there on my previous visit, similarly presented. A place where the different is normal. Only complaint, as mentioned in other reports, the tv remote is slow and channel selection system, cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: “Too many worries...”
Reviews.Author: Flowwolf
Reviews.Content: We have been booked into this hotel (congress) and looked forward to check it out. It had too many imperfections. From unresponsive front desk staff, small rooms (no space to work), expensive in-room wi-fi, slow wi-fi at reception (but free, for 30 mins), to nonexistent catering during the congress. Should rather be 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Pink on the Spree”
Reviews.Author: Betsy2003
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for color with a high hipster factor then this is the place for you. Be sure to upgrade to a junior suite if you want a little more room. The small rooms are small. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Service in the lounge was slow but friendly. I was drawn to the hotel because of it's location. The hotel is a fiive minute walk to O2 World (attended a spectacular Rammstein concert). Also it's close to the Ostbahnhof (15 minute walk) and on the way you can visit the Eastside Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Chicas1977
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying here in December 2011 and fell in love with the hotel! It´s just so fun and unique with all the fun details sorted out. Cool lobby, great bar and loungearea and an amazing restaurant. The head chef has worked at fame Barcelona restaurant El Bulli and the food was fantastic! Breakfast was good - and I loved the presentation of everything. Hotel room was beautiful with large bathroom and a lot of small amenities. I would recommend a room facing the river- try a junior suite. They are so spacious. All in all a fun experience. Maybe not the best location for first time tourists, but I would stay here anyway. Only negative is that wifi is not included. A trendy, hip hotel as this should have it included. You do get vouchers for wifi in the lobby free of charge, but each connection is only for 30 minutes at a time. A "must try" hotel in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish an cool location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: alberto_bruni_photo
Reviews.Content: This hotel becomes one of my favorite when I´am in Berlin. I like the very stylish concept of this hotel. It´s something strange but very cool. The stuff are joung and very helpfull. I booked several times a Junior-Suite. This rooms are large and fresh with this colour-concept of the hotel. The bathroom is amazing. Breakfast is very good with a great view on the river beside the hotel. The location in a quarter with former factorys and next to the underground-Station "Warschauer Strasse" is stylish with some cool restaurants and galeries around.

Reviews.Title: “Novelty hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0lidays_fr0m_hell_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Berlin as my husband had some business meetings at the O2 Berlin , when we checked in I felt as If I had walked into a film set on a spaceship movie! It was bizarre, very pink... The staff welcomed us and checked us in earlier than the normal check in time which was nice, the lift again was very very pink, our room was not big but adequate for our needs, the bathroom was good although only a shower and no bath, there were pink complimentary toiletries , the room in my opinion felt a bit cheaply done, the floor was like a printed laminate so therefore you could hear noise from above , it wasnt too much of a problem for us but the people we travelled with we're kept awake by the room above moving chairs etc, Breakfast was average, it was buffet style within a large pink object! continental is the best option as the cooked (hot) breakfast was always cold, we were never offered coffee without having to attract the attention of a member of staff , there were only a few tables occupied so I was expecting service to be a bit better. It's a shame that wifi is not included or at least a reasonable price, Taking everything into consideration I would probably look elsewhere but am glad that we have been as it was a quirky and fun design andvery close to the O2 where we needed to be .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FLAvour
Reviews.Content: I've spent two nights in this hotel and I've found it simply amazing. It's fantastic for music lovers! Rooms are clean and spacious, I was afraid to find it too shocking for colours and furniture shapes but surprisingly it was well balanced. Views are incredible! Staff was friendly and very helpful, we asked for different pillows and housekeepers brought in my room two kind of pillows to choose. The hotel is ideally located, few steps from East Side Gallery and Universal Musci headquarters, and O2 for events. You can always find cabs outside. The only negative is breakfast, too pricey, maybe because there aren't many other places to have breakfast nearby. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “nice design hotel with recording studio”
Reviews.Author: scotprague
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little on the small side but if you can get an offer on price - through a website then it can be good value. Breakfast is expensive, so we didnt use that option. They are trying to get into the market for bands and touring and so have 2 recording studios on the upper floor areas. They also have parking for tour busses and offer guests free use of electric guitars. There is free car parking outside the hotel / or paid underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: woookash
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, service as well (extras are generously charged, including the wifi (but vouchers are available for free in the lobby to use the wifi there (30 min at once))). Hotel location is nice (5 minutes walk to s and u-bahn station Warschauer Straße). If you have the time, talk the walk along the east side gallery to the Ostbahnhof (takes 20-30 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “Pink Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjohann
Reviews.Content: It all started a bit wrong when we were asked at reception whether we wanted a pink room or a blue room. When we got to the room we said "but we asked for the blue room" to which the answer was "this is the blue room". Cheap, tacky decor makes the whole hotel feel like Hello Kitty's bedroom. Tiny rooms. Pink accessories, pink walls, pink highlights on a cheap plastic floor. Their idea of a non-pink room is literally a pink room with blue highlights. Fine if you are into that sort of thing, but hardly what one would expect in one of the few "5 star" hotels in Berlin. Like the rest of Berlin, "5 star" really means 4 star, "4 star" really means 3 star, and so on. To call this place a 5 star is a joke - it has more in common with a Japanese Love Hotel than anything on par with world 5 star standards. The funniest part about our stay was bumping into the legions of 50-something conference attendees going up and down in the fluorescent painted lifts. Heads of Pharmaceutical companies and Oxford professors all had the oddest looks on their faces as they exchanged comments about the preposterous decor. I daresay that if this place wants to be taken seriously as a business hotel, and it seems it does, (of course the "musician" market in Berlin isn't going to fill that property night after night), it will need to rip out the whole of that interior decor and start again. Their sales force seems to have done a good job of selling at least a couple of conferences into the pharma industry - but the days of Roche selling LSD are far behind us and I would be mightily surprised if they get repeat bookings next year. I know that if I had organized a conference in Berlin for my customers and suppliers and we ended up in this pink monstrosity I'd be running in shame for the rest of the decade. Probably the worst decorated, over-priced and over-hyped property I've stayed in all year. And i LIVE in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: pdw_bxl
Reviews.Content: Great concept, nice furniture, concept works from A to Z. Just just have to like pink, and I do. Even the wired internet cable is. It's all about detail

Reviews.Title: “Very nice decorated”
Reviews.Author: patjem
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for the way it looks. What I don't like is that you have to pay €17 for the wifi service. I hate that with Swisscom. It's overpriced

Reviews.Title: “out of the ordinary, refreshingly different”
Reviews.Author: jeroen1967
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 5 days on a business trip and for the first time I actually didn't want to leave the hotel. Great interior design and finally a different approach to a hotel. Great Sauna as well. Mostly impressed with the restaurant as it lives up to the status of the design.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but expensive”
Reviews.Author: J80-benelux
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with the whole family in September. Our booking wasn't smooth, as our reservation through Booking.com got lost. We rebooked the rooms (several e-mails were needed until the date and number of people were correct), and were charged a 30 euro higher room price per night. The hotel is very trendy with a beautiful view over the river. The location is good, it takes you 10-15 minutes by bike to reach Alexander platz. For the party lovers, it is very close to several famous clubs. On Saturday night, the ground floor of the hotel was turned into a club. We could hear the basses up to the 4th floor. To conclude, nhow is a very trendy, but expensive, hotel most suitable for the party loving people.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & Groovy”
Reviews.Author: richer43
Reviews.Content: The Nhow is the perfect place to stay in Berlin...situated on the River Spree, it provides easy access to both East and West Berlin. Its good value too. The modern design is stylish and it has great facilities for music heads. The bar area is very swish, serving great cocktails. Rooms are funky and well equipped although we had problems connecting our UK Ipod into the docking station. The staff are fantastic, very pleasant and extremely helpful and recommended many excellent places for us to visit. One thing to bear in mind is that its not close to Alexanderplatz where many of the typical tourist attractions are located. Overall, had a great time and would most definitely return...sooner rather than later I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - unless you're allergic to pink”
Reviews.Author: RaphaelBE
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, the thing that sets this hotel apart from others in Berlin is its very liberal use of the colour pink. Yes, the reception is pink, as is the door of your hotel room, as is the glass wall separating the room from the bathroom as is... well, you get it. But just to be sure: yes, the bedsheets are pink as well and so is the phone next to your bed. I only stayed one night, but I'm guessing the appearance of this one color just about everywhere might get tiring after a while. Then again, this is a very decent hotel that has much to offer. It's right besides the river and at least some of the rooms have very good views. It's also brand new and offers a good, healthy breakfast with lots of choice. Even during my short stay, I became a fan of the excellent rainshower. Minus points? Yes, a few: the tv-set is hidden in some sort of mirror that makes it hard to use during daylight. And in my case, I found a spider in the bathroom. Hard to avoid probably, but not a very nice experience to be sure. At least it wasn't pink.

Reviews.Title: “Almost unique in the world”
Reviews.Author: GFigari
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new Hotel,in Berlin hotest área . Overall , and specialy the 8th floor is designed to host musicians and equiped with the most advanced technology for the music business.

Reviews.Title: “Punching above it's weight”
Reviews.Author: rvrman21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is trying to be oh so trendy. It's in the "creative" area with MTV and a lot of media companies. It overlooks the river and in summers is lovely, in winter you can see the ice breakers chugging up the river. The restaurant is good, but standard bedrooms small. But one thing you cannot ignore is the decor. I am sure it appeals to young 20 / 30 somethings, but it gave me a headache, especially the pink bedroom. The TV embedded in the mirror looks great, and must have been expensive, but you cannot see it because of the refections.

Reviews.Title: “"Trendy" Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SwissTravelist
Reviews.Content: The Nhow is brand new, located in the east of Berlin facing the river Spree, The interior design is flashy, in my opinion it tries to be sexier than it actually is, but nevertheless a good option in Berlin. cool bar, although the crowd is not as glamourous as the design of the Hotel suggests.

Reviews.Title: “Pink Palace on the Spree”
Reviews.Author: martinthelimey
Reviews.Content: outside and inside, this hotel has something to Say. Not quite sure what it is ("Wir sind cool!" maybe?)....very striking abstract lobby/reception area (very glad of free espresso/capuccino machine on my 5.30am checkout, needed that jolt to get me moving), free use of Apples in business centre for people like me who don't want to schlep a laptop and STILL don't have a smartphone, very nice and extensive breakfast buffet (included for me, so didn't have to worry about the 30 EUR or whatever they get for it). Oh, the rooms...strange lino-like floor, I guess to absorb sound if you take advantage of the loaner guitars and have a jam session. And very pink! The bed linens...the bathroom...the toiletries...they have two recording studios here and advertise themselves as "the hotel where music lives" (hmm, guess there aren't any Hard Rock hotels in Germany?)....great view out over the Spree, including a chunk of the wall set outside the breakfast room. Very nice hotel, color scheme takes a bit of getting used to, very friendly staff, not sure about the value for money as I wasn't paying! But if you are <30 and got a few Euro....not a bad choice in Berlin. oh hey, almost forgot, elevators are all different colors inside! Including, you won't believe it......pink.

Reviews.Title: “I wold NEVER go back to this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: minty77
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in the middle of july, 2011. Thank god it was for one night!! I think this hotel is SUPER over priced and the service is terrible here. They charge you for almost everything and I was so very disappointed at the interior and the look of the place. It only looks good in the pictures, but when you are actually there, it is a smallest hotel and is not so clean. The rooms are so tiny with tiny bathrooms and really really ugly pink tiles on the bathroom floor. They tried to make the place look cool, but I thought the place looked pretty bad. Some people at the reception desk didn't speak english which made it difficult for me and also they were extremely rude, I found pretty much all of the staff to be rude. Look somewhere else, really waste of your money here!!!! Don't be fooled by the pictures like me!! also wifi is not free here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: elleborch
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our weekend at nhow. The breakfast was delicious, fresh and varied. Best hotel breakfast I have tried. The room was ... pink.... but really well designed and cool. Wellnes area was really nice. Service was excellent! The only glitch: The TV entertainment system was hopelessly slow and mainly shows music channels. And do not open the window after nightfall, hundreds(!) of moscitoes flew in in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit pink”
Reviews.Author: cyberman
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel ist not perfect for visitor, who want to see the City; but it is ok to a part of the berlin-scene. The hall looks good, it is a modern styling. On one side of the house there is a normal busy road, but the rooms are quiet. On the other side there you will find the waterfront - if it is possible, take one of this rooms. And now, the rooms: they are not so spacious, but it is ok. Not everybodys thing: the pink colours in the rooms, to much for my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “This place tests your patience”
Reviews.Author: kceteew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 night. I had anticipated a good visit because I've read about how trendy this place is. Well, it is trendy but it has no soul. First, to survive the stay, you must like pink or be able to appreciate a high dose of it. I went into a pink lift and thought I was swallowed up by Hello Kitty! The rooms are big for European standards but it was my visit to Germany so perhaps all German hotel rooms are large. There is no free wifi in the room, and even for the paid version at 10+euros, you cannot download past 500MB! the free wifi is only at the hotel's lobby and it is limited to 30 minutes usage. The toilet was tiny but could live with that. Still, it was very very pink. The front office staff really makes you feel like you've just wasted their time. Except for one friendly woman, everyone else was gruff and wouldn't hesitate to bark at you. Except for the Berlin Wall, there is not much else near the hotel. And there is no swimming pool in the hotel but there is a gym. The plusses are: 1. The hotel is near both the U and S Ban stations, so if you need to travel out, it is a 10 minutes walk to the station. 2. The breakfast service inside the - once again - pink restaurant is very good. And probably all the friendly staff work there. 3. The hotel is quite a stunner, and offers a lovely view of the river. And in summertime, it can be enchanting.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: julia_t86
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night here and absolutely loved it! The service was very friendly and efficient. There was always someone at the reception and the bar was open till 2am on a Tuesday. The design is great and very detailed, even thou we stayed in a room that was completely pink. Everything is very modern with the TV build into the mirror. The location is great too. Only short distance from the train stations (easily walkable by foot) and less than 30Euros cab ride from Schoenefeld airport. I would definitely recommend the hotel to everyone who likes something fresh and boutiquie... But careful while we got a good prepaid deal any extra costs at the hotel can be a bit pricey (i.e. 22Euros per person for a breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Good and pink at nice location”
Reviews.Author: DutchDesire
Reviews.Content: Good location on river bank, just a few minutes walk from the lively Kreuzberg area. Focus on modern design with bright colours (mostly pink), nice, something different. Most things were functional though, except for the glass working table where the computer mouse isn't working and the tv which is difficult to use and unworkable slow. Large walk-in shower instead of a bath, very good. Pretty loud music in all public areas, I did not appreciate that at breakfast time. Nice staff. Decent sized rooms, no noise nor light from outside, good bed. Quality breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Cool Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piyush47
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin for the first time and had a fantastic deal at NHOW Berlin. Great Hotel Location - near to really cool and happening area - Chic hotel, great service from all the staff / receptionist / conceierge to room service and Breakfast was really something. Location is great overlooking the river / both Metro and Train Station nearby - about 15minutes walk and you are in a great area for Bars / Food / Restaurants. A specail thanks to the Receptionist - Cristian - who helped us with Booking the ticket to Government Building - the Concerige was really great - recommended great resturants and booked a great table for us lastminute - both on Saturday and Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Boraxwoman
Reviews.Content: One of the most intriguing hotels we've stayed in. Excellent location, and we had views of the Oberbaumbruecke and the Spree from our windows. Everything was clean and new. The staff were friendly and the concierge was particularly helpful and got our theatre tickets for us. This hotel is full of new ideas, some of which work better than others. The bathroom was excellent, particularly the walk-in shower, and the nice pink toiletries. The bed was comfy. Downsides were when ideas had overtaken beyond practicality: the TV built into the mirror was not only difficult to operate with the very sluggish, annoying remote, but also strange to watch when we did get it working, as the mirror was still a mirror, so our reflections were superimposed on the TV picture. I had expected an iPod dock, but instead had to borrow a lead which did not charge my iPod and which had to work through the aforementioned TV/mirror/sluggish remote. I was given another lead to charge the iPod, but all that did wad freeze the iPod. Instead of bedside tables, niches are moulded into the walls beside the bed, and these niches are too small. The chair was designed for visual rather than comfort appeal, and if we'd stayed one night longer, the swirly pattern on the floor would have set headaches going. Unfortunately, the internet access was not only not free, but very expensive. However, the tea/coffee making facilities were very welcome. But despite these niggles, I would recommend this hotel. We didn't order a guitar from room service; maybe next time? The gym and sauna were pleasant to use, the room was large enough (it was a superior room) and the buffet breakfast was more than excellent with an extra plus! We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: dylanmike1
Reviews.Content: We stay every year in several hotels all over Europe, NHOW Berlin is the best we ever had! Great styling of whole hotel; lounge, reception, restaurant, even elevator. Room was perfect with amazing coloures and material. Staff was very kind, always available to make your stay perfect. We will certainly come back and recommend it to everybody; also for people with children.

Reviews.Title: “Very pink, but quite good”
Reviews.Author: SawtoothinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just one night but the hotel was efficient, friendly, clean and functional. My room was also extremely bright pink, which is unusual. But the room was comfortable and very conveniently designed and equipped. Breakfast was very good and the terrace is nice, in good weather a lovely place to relax by the river. Friendly and efficient staff. Had a company rate which meant the hotel was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pompous overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: steffie161177
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over designed and the client ends up paying for it... At 200$ per night you would expect free Wi-Fi access in the rooms not to mention the 30$ breakfast... Rooms are small and wil look really kitch in a few years Takes 5 seconds to change from onechanel to the other on the TV Impossible to zap

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay- really trendy, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECWalsh
Reviews.Content: brilliant stay, super friendly staff, really comfy, interesting rooms. New and very clean. Great cocktail menu. We got a special birthday surprise of chocolates and fruit delivered- very nice touch. Easy to get to on S Bahn. Will definately be back!! Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel - beautifully designed”
Reviews.Author: RKOesch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the brand new hotel "nhow" in Berlin. The interior design by Karim Rashid was just awesome. We upgraded to a superior room whith a fantastic view over the river Spree. The room in all the fancy colors pink & blue with a beautiful rain shower was fantastic as well as the high quality beauty products provided by the hotel. All the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is just great and we certainly will come back to this amazing place again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst restaurant experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Richdj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice , restaurant is rubbish ! Waited 2 hours for starters to arrive and another half for mains , restaurant said it was because the were busy but not all tables were full ! Get more staff please - awful experience !!! Almost gave up and went for a kebab

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Even with kids!”
Reviews.Author: nordictexan
Reviews.Content: We (family of four w/ two little girls 5 & 2) just spent a weekend in Berlin. I have stayed at other NH hotels and received an email about this new property in Berlin, so decided to stay there for a short family trip. It's a bit different with the "music" theme, but we had a fantastic time. The staff were incredibly accommodating. Concierge and front desk were super nice, even with the children. And the room was absolutely immaculate. We had a junior suite and the bathroom was huge. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone that likes modern architecture. And yes, even for families with little children as again, the staff were absolutely fantastic. Many compliments to the concierge and bar staff who were particularly energetic and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located for The o2 World”
Reviews.Author: EiboNewbury
Reviews.Content: Pretty garish pink rooms , but comfortable and adequate for requirements. No wifi in room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: nivster1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at nhow during NYE 2010-11. Hotel is brand new, amazingly designed, and stunning hotel. They have a flat-screen TV with external connectors (Rare!) at the room's desk to connect a laptop. Rooms are well designed, spacious, brand new and very clean! When we were there they had an ice skating ring. Breakfast is one of the best breakfasts I've had in Europe and well worth the money! Hotel is close to Ubahn and Sbahn stations as well as excellent nightlife. Highly recommended!
